metadata.description: WWII Historical Figures - Allied/Axis leaders, military commanders, resistance, intelligence, scientists. Batch ID: wwii-cluster-phase1-1738613000

figures.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
figures.description: 32nd President of the United States, led Allies during WWII

figures.name: Joseph Stalin
figures.description: Leader of the Soviet Union during WWII

figures.name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
figures.description: Supreme Commander of Allied Forces in Europe, led D-Day invasion

figures.name: Douglas MacArthur
figures.description: Supreme Commander of Allied Forces in Southwest Pacific

figures.name: George S. Patton
figures.description: US Army general, led Third Army in European Theater

figures.name: Bernard Montgomery
figures.description: British Field Marshal, commanded Eighth Army at El Alamein

figures.name: Charles de Gaulle
figures.description: Leader of Free French Forces, later President of France

figures.name: Benito Mussolini
figures.description: Fascist dictator of Italy, Axis leader

figures.name: Hideki Tojo
figures.description: Prime Minister of Japan during WWII

figures.name: Erwin Rommel
figures.description: German Field Marshal, 'Desert Fox', Afrika Korps commander

figures.name: Hermann Göring
figures.description: Commander of Luftwaffe, Hitler's designated successor

figures.name: Heinrich Himmler
figures.description: Reichsführer of the SS, architect of the Holocaust

figures.name: Joseph Goebbels
figures.description: Nazi Minister of Propaganda

figures.name: Georgy Zhukov
figures.description: Marshal of the Soviet Union, led defense of Moscow and capture of Berlin

figures.name: Isoroku Yamamoto
figures.description: Japanese Marshal Admiral, planned Pearl Harbor attack

figures.name: Harry S. Truman
figures.description: 33rd US President, authorized atomic bombings of Japan

figures.name: Chester W. Nimitz
figures.description: US Fleet Admiral, Commander in Chief Pacific Fleet

figures.name: Omar Bradley
figures.description: US Army general, commanded First Army in D-Day invasion

figures.name: Heinz Guderian
figures.description: German general, pioneer of blitzkrieg tank warfare

figures.name: Erich von Manstein
figures.description: German Field Marshal, planned invasion of France

figures.name: Clement Attlee
figures.description: British Deputy Prime Minister during WWII, succeeded Churchill

figures.name: Neville Chamberlain
figures.description: British Prime Minister at war's outbreak, known for appeasement policy

figures.name: Anne Frank
figures.description: Holocaust victim, diarist

figures.name: Oskar Schindler
figures.description: German industrialist who saved 1,200 Jews

figures.name: Raoul Wallenberg
figures.description: Swedish diplomat who saved thousands of Hungarian Jews

figures.name: Elie Wiesel
figures.description: Holocaust survivor, author of Night

figures.name: J. Robert Oppenheimer
figures.description: Director of Manhattan Project, father of atomic bomb

figures.name: Enrico Fermi
figures.description: Physicist, key figure in Manhattan Project

figures.name: Leslie Groves
figures.description: US Army general, directed Manhattan Project

figures.name: Alan Turing
figures.description: British mathematician, broke Enigma code at Bletchley Park

figures.name: Reinhard Heydrich
figures.description: High-ranking Nazi official, architect of Final Solution

figures.name: Adolf Eichmann
figures.description: Nazi SS officer, organizer of Holocaust logistics

figures.name: Albert Speer
figures.description: Nazi architect, Minister of Armaments

figures.name: Karl Dönitz
figures.description: Grand Admiral, commander of U-boat fleet, Hitler's successor

figures.name: Rudolf Hess
figures.description: Deputy Führer, flew to Scotland in 1941

figures.name: Joachim von Ribbentrop
figures.description: Nazi Foreign Minister

figures.name: Konstantin Rokossovsky
figures.description: Soviet Marshal, led forces at Stalingrad and Kursk

figures.name: Ivan Konev
figures.description: Soviet Marshal, liberated Prague and Ukraine

figures.name: Vasily Chuikov
figures.description: Soviet general, defended Stalingrad

figures.name: Kliment Voroshilov
figures.description: Soviet Marshal, People's Commissar of Defense

figures.name: Friedrich Paulus
figures.description: German Field Marshal, surrendered at Stalingrad

figures.name: Wilhelm Keitel
figures.description: Chief of German Armed Forces High Command

figures.name: Alfred Jodl
figures.description: German Chief of Operations Staff

figures.name: Claus von Stauffenberg
figures.description: German officer, led July 20 plot to assassinate Hitler

figures.name: Gerd von Rundstedt
figures.description: German Field Marshal, Commander-in-Chief West

figures.name: Josip Broz Tito
figures.description: Yugoslav partisan leader and post-war leader

figures.name: Chiang Kai-shek
figures.description: Chinese Nationalist leader during WWII

figures.name: Mao Zedong
figures.description: Chinese Communist leader during WWII

figures.name: Hirohito
figures.description: Emperor of Japan during WWII

figures.name: William Slim
figures.description: British Field Marshal, defeated Japanese in Burma

figures.name: Louis Mountbatten
figures.description: British Supreme Allied Commander South East Asia

figures.name: Claire Chennault
figures.description: Commander of Flying Tigers in China

figures.name: Curtis LeMay
figures.description: US Air Force general, led strategic bombing campaign against Japan

figures.name: Jimmy Doolittle
figures.description: Led first US air raid on Tokyo after Pearl Harbor

figures.name: William Halsey Jr.
figures.description: US Fleet Admiral, led forces in Pacific

figures.name: Raymond Spruance
figures.description: US Admiral, won Battle of Midway

figures.name: Holland Smith
figures.description: US Marine general, led amphibious assaults in Pacific

figures.name: Arthur Harris
figures.description: RAF Air Chief Marshal, led strategic bombing of Germany

figures.name: Stanisław Mikołajczyk
figures.description: Polish resistance leader, Prime Minister-in-exile

figures.name: Jean Moulin
figures.description: French Resistance leader

figures.name: Wladyslaw Sikorski
figures.description: Polish Prime Minister-in-exile and Commander-in-Chief

figures.name: Edvard Beneš
figures.description: President of Czechoslovakia, led government-in-exile

figures.name: Vidkun Quisling
figures.description: Norwegian collaborationist, namesake for traitor

figures.name: Philippe Pétain
figures.description: Head of Vichy France, collaborationist regime

figures.name: Pierre Laval
figures.description: Prime Minister of Vichy France

figures.name: George VI
figures.description: King of the United Kingdom during WWII

figures.name: Eleanor Roosevelt
figures.description: First Lady of the United States, humanitarian

figures.name: Vyacheslav Molotov
figures.description: Soviet Foreign Minister, signed Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact

figures.name: Lavrentiy Beria
figures.description: Soviet secret police chief, headed Soviet atomic bomb project

figures.name: Anthony Eden
figures.description: British Foreign Secretary during WWII

figures.name: George Marshall
figures.description: US Chief of Staff, architect of Allied strategy, Marshall Plan

figures.name: Henry Stimson
figures.description: US Secretary of War

figures.name: Ernie Pyle
figures.description: American war correspondent

figures.name: Edward R. Murrow
figures.description: CBS correspondent, covered Blitz from London

figures.name: William Shirer
figures.description: War correspondent, author of The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
